{{Wireless embedded system |brand=BroMax |model=WA304-UF |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/18/2002 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=O6M-WA304-UF |ic_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Ubicom |cpu1_model=IP2022 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=PCMCIA (16-bit) |expansion_pcmcia_num=1 |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=BroMax WM300-IF |wi1_module_if=PCMCIA (16-bit) |wi1_chip1_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip1_model=ISL3871IN33 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=ISL3684 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''11Mbps Wireless Access Point with 4-port 10/100M LAN Switch''
This FCC ID defines two devices... *'''WA304-UF''' **4-port Switch for LAN *'''WA301-UF''' **Single LAN port "WA304-UF REV:XB" is silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos. "WM300-IF REV: XA" is silkscreened on the wireless module in the FCC photos. :The ISL3871 used on the wireless module is an ISL3871IN33. The FCC manual specifies the default SSID pattern as '''GROUPXXXXXX''' and default IP as 192.168.1.100.
